Subject: - 
Security   check of Photographic equipment and film 
 
  Photographic equipment and films will be subjected to following 
security checks before these are allowed to be carried on board an aircraft: 
 
 
1. All photographic equipment and film should be x-ray screened. X-
ray baggage inspection system installed at Indian airports, both for 
cabin as well as checked baggage, will not affect images captured 
by a digital camera. In addition, it will also not affect films that have 
already been processed, slides, videos, photo compact discs or 
picture discs. 
 
2. However, if a passenger requests for hand-inspection of an 
undeveloped, high speed and specialty film, the screener may 
inspect the same by hand. For this, the screener should ask the 
passenger to remove the undeveloped film from the canister for 
manual examination.  The screener must satisfy himself about 
genuineness of the film before clearing it for carriage on board the 
aircraft. 
 
3. Airlines should encourage passengers to remove undeveloped 
film from canister and pack it in a clear plastic bag to facilitate its 
hand-inspection at the security check point. Further, to avoid 
concerns that the undeveloped film may be damaged by X-ray BIS, 
the airlines should also advise passengers that they should get their 
films processed locally before passing through airport security on 
return trip. 
 
 
(R.C. Tayal) 
Offg. Commissioner of Security (CA)
